description.raw:
Added support for flippers in the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin.

I’ve right away made it ABI-compatible with gazebo9 \(I needed to change the type of one of the member variables\). Now I really regret I haven’t PIMPLized even the “leaf” plugin classes, but just the TrackedVehiclePlugin common ancestor. The reviewers should be more strict about PIMPLizing new stuff :smiley:

The PR is structured so that if you cherry-pick everything except commits [91c6858](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/91c68584e02e75f1347a3b59872eaf9ce7eee7b9) and [d34bd4a](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/d34bd4a28dbbf7a9bb6fa97aa60f8b88b8b914e1?at=gazebo9), you get the nicer version without the ugly ABI-compatibility global variable.

The PR added options to mark links as either left/right flipper, which means these links will behave as if they were the main tracks in contact with terrain. Any kind of articulation of the flippers is left to the user using the standard joint controller mechanisms.

I’ve right away made it ABI-compatible with gazebo9 (I needed to change the type of one of the member variables). Now I really regret I haven’t PIMPLized even the “leaf” plugin classes, but just the TrackedVehiclePlugin common ancestor. The reviewers should be more strict about PIMPLizing new stuff

The PR is structured so that if you cherry-pick everything except commits 91c6858 and d34bd4a, you get the nicer version without the ugly ABI-compatibility global variable.

The PR added options to mark links as either left/right flipper, which means these links will behave as if they were the main tracks in contact with terrain. Any kind of articulation of the flippers is left to the user using the standard joint controller mechanisms.
